Person B: You’re a manager. Manage.
Person B: Your Eminences, before we eat I should like to introduce a new member of our order, whose existence was not known to any of us until a few hours ago. This is because our brother was made a cardinal by a perfectly legitimate procedure known as creation in pectore. The reason why it had to be done this way is known only to God and to the late Holy Father. But I think we can guess well enough as our new brother’s ministry is an extremely dangerous one.
Person B: Would you bless our meal, Eminence?

Person A: I want you to know that I very much agreed with your homily yesterday.
Person A: We are all tested in our faith, Dean. W e all lapse. But the Christian faith is, above all, a message of forgiveness.
Person B: And tolerance.
Person A: Exactly. Tolerance. I trust that when this election is over, your moderating voice will be heard in the very highest counsels of the Church. It certainly will be if I have anything to do with it. The very highest counsels.

Person B: With respect, Joshua, how she came here is secondary to the issue of your relationship with her.
Person B: And the child?
Person B: No, Your Eminence. She was very young. Nineteen years old. You were thirty.
